title: quirky-6.1.3
description:
released 14 Jan 2014

The Release Notes, with installation instructions, are here: [url]http://distro.ibiblio.org/quirky/quirky6/x86/quirky-6.1/release-Quirky-6.1.htm[/url]

extracts: Announcement and release notes for Quirky 6.1

Quirky is my fun project to explore new ideas for Linux

In a nutshell, Quirky6 is intended to be as small as possible (hence compiled from source in T2), very fast, very simple, optimised to run on Flash memory media, and very quirky. There are other extended ideas that are in the pipeline.

Quirky6 is a fork of Puppy, but has meandered off on his own quirky direction, becoming substantially different "under the hood". However, the applications, utilities and user-interface remain much the same as Puppy -- so you have the same ease-of-use, but even a bit easier. Also, you can go to the main Puppy forum and get involved, as you will find their broad agenda embraces such offshoots as Quirky.
